identity.name: On-Chain Identity
identity.description: Your wallet address is your identity in DeFi. Unlike traditional accounts, it's pseudonymous, portable, and owned by you.

commitment.name: Time Commitment
commitment.description: Many DeFi protocols reward long-term participation. Time-weighted mechanisms align incentives between users and protocols.

transactions.name: Smart Contract Transactions
transactions.description: Interacting with DeFi means calling smart contract functions. Each transaction costs gas and is permanently recorded on-chain.

socialRecovery.name: Social Recovery & Identity
socialRecovery.description: Linking verifiable identities (ENS, Farcaster) adds a recovery layer and builds reputation across protocols.

yieldMechanics.name: Time-Weighted Yield
yieldMechanics.description: Protocols often distribute rewards based on how long you've participated, not just how much. Patience is rewarded.

protocolDiversity.name: Protocol Diversity
protocolDiversity.description: DeFi is an ecosystem of specialized protocols. Exploring different contracts teaches you the building blocks of decentralized finance.

networkEffects.name: Network Effects
networkEffects.description: Protocols grow through referrals and community. Your network becomes part of your on-chain reputation.

tokenApprovals.name: Token Approvals
tokenApprovals.description: Before a protocol can move your tokens, you must approve it. Understanding approvals is critical for DeFi security.

consistency.name: Consistent Participation
consistency.description: Regular engagement compounds benefits. Many protocols reward consistent activity over sporadic large actions.

vesting.name: Vesting & Lock Mechanisms
vesting.description: Locking tokens for extended periods often unlocks additional benefits. It signals long-term alignment.

attestations.name: Cryptographic Attestations
attestations.description: Signing messages proves ownership without spending gas. It's used for voting, commitments, and off-chain verification.

metaLearning.name: Meta-Learning
metaLearning.description: Understanding how to learn DeFi is as important as learning individual concepts. Build mental models and verify understanding.

mastery.name: Chapter Mastery
mastery.description: Completing a chapter demonstrates comprehensive understanding of foundational DeFi concepts.
